text:
Bottle at the brewery. Shared with Brandon and his wife. Pours Clear Ruby, small white pink head, some lacing. Aroma is Vinous, funk, cotton candy. Flavor is light tart, lt funk, low acidity. Medium body, low carbonation
5,7,8,4,16

Bottle at Cantillon, split 3 ways with the wife and Mike (bytemesis), cheers! Pours a deep purple, slightly murky. No head, no lace. Aromas of grape jam, WelchÂ’s grape juice, medium horse blanket funk, light oak and light hay. Taste is fairly soft, compared to reg St. Lam. Mild acidic note into medium tart grape, vinous notes, nice oak touch. Medium hay, earth, light sweet grape juice. Finishes nicely balanced, with tiny bitter brett and medium grape juice. A bit flat, but definitely a great beer.

Bottle at the brewery. Clear dark pink color with some off-white big bubbles. Aroma has really nice floral funk with ripe fruits on top. Taste is slightly acidic with red grape juice flavor, more sour in the middle, really dry and fruity. Almost flat, light to medium body.

Keg at Arrogant Sour Fest 2017. It pours a deep purple color with almost no head. Aroma is tart acidic and funky fruity with notes of tart red grape skin, green apple, lemon peel. Taste is tart acidic fruity with soft funk. Mostly notes of red grapes, green apple, lemon peel, barnyard. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Overall, tasty

75CL at the brewery. ItÂ’s a dark muted purple color. Blood red. This smells amazing. Smells like a smuckers grape jelly, old shoe, leather and cherry juice. ItÂ’s pretty much flat which is a bummer. Not sure if others had this with carbonation or itÂ’s just me. If you take a big gulp, itÂ’s a very acidic tart puckering feeling on the back of your throat. The flavor itself isnÂ’t actually jammy. ItÂ’s more like wet vine, soil, leaves, apple and some cherry. Grape is of course there but no need to mention that. ItÂ’s tingly in the sourness with a hardcore swish. More jelly. Finish is earthy and bold with a resting bitternesss

@ArrogantSourFestival
Rosso ciliegia opalescente, schiuma praticamente inesistente.
Aroma di cuoio, sudore equino, lattico e cantina, acetone, leggero legno secco, leggera mela verde.
Al palato attacca con uva rossa e mela verde, intermezzo acetico non troppo marcato, finale legnoso accompagnato da cuoio, cantina e stallatico.
Poco carbonata, corpo medio pieno

Bottle at Cantillon Brewery, Brussels. Deep red with no head. The aroma has notes of red wine, wild yeasts, wood, vinegar, sweetish, funky. Sourish flavor with notes of Merlot wine, wood and vinegar. Watery, flat, light to medium-bodied. Excellent.
Niesamowicie gÅ‚adkie, wrÄ™cz oleiste. Cudowny charakter czerwonego wina. DÄ…b, taniny, masa skÃ³rek czerwonych winogron, skÃ³ra, bretty, migdaÅ‚y

Backlog, sample from bottle at cantillon, poured deep dark red to purple with a Tiny white head. Nose of big vineous notes, oak, light crisp malts, big red grape notes, funk, spiced brett notes, apples and cowwebs. Big vineous wine notes, dry tart mouthfeel

Bottle at the brewery. Hazy pink-red. Aroma is funky with notes of grapes, red wine and oak. Sour, berries, grapes, red wine, wood, a bit lactic, tasty and balanced. Medium-bodied, smooth, low Â–medium carbonation. Great.
Bottle at Cantillon. Red body with a small white head. Red grapes, yeast, light dusty, tart, oak, fruity. Lovely and easy drinking.
Estupenda versiÃ³n que rompe los lÃ­mites entre el vino y la cerveza. Seca, sin astringencia y con el toque inconfundible del vino. EXcelente.

Bottle - Vinous notes with nice juicy fruity notes. Deep reddish with a light white head. Vinous and red fruit really shines, touch of grape peel and a long light red wine skin with oak. Very light and drinkable.

Bottled. Pours light hazy ruby and a tiny white head. Aromas Of funk, vinegar, oaky, red grapes, citrus and some wood. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and quite tart. Medium bodied, watery to oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Lambic indeed. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ

Bottle at Cantillon, shared with SinH4. Pours slightly foggy cherry ruby with almost no head. Aroma is distinct grapes and some barrel with tannins, very little funk. Medium body, decently tart and sour, still fruity sweet grapes, but a little stingy in bitterness towards the palate. Still a smooth experience leading to a dry palate. Almost no Lambic properties left, almost no funk throughout. Very good!

UPDATED: APR 21, 2017 Bottle shared with anstei at Cantillon, my 30th Cantillon tick. Hazy ruby color with small soapy head. Aroma is lots of mellow grapes, just a touch of funk at the first smell, afterwards lots of grapes. Taste has mellow grapes, peppery, and quite some tanninic bitterness in the finish. Very soft mouthfeel with just an ? (epsilon) of carbonation. Very nice and mellow, definitely more straight into the grapes than regular St Lam.

My Bottom Line:
This extremely juicy iteration of St-Lamvinus almost forgets that it is a Lambic, focusing instead of the character of the grapes it harbors.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A ring of foam tops the pinkish red haze.
-These grapes are pretty evocative.
-Carbonation is quite low, which increases the impression of juiciness.
-Acidity levels are moderate for Cantillon.

Bottle.

Bottle shared, thanks Simon! Lightly hazy deep red pour with pinkish foam. Aroma is winey, spicy, light cherry, winey, lots of oak. Taste is tart, light acetic notes, winey. Palate is med bodied, good carbonation. Nice.

Bottle (750 m) at tasting. Massive thanks to Simon for sharing! Clear deep purple-ish red with a minimal bubbly ring of foam, no retention or lacing. Aroma is intensely red grapes forward with a well integrated oak spiciness, some cobweb/musty basement notes - but much less than the Carignan and Menu Pineau we had just before - mineral notes and light herbalness. Taste is vinous with red grapes aplenty, mild oak spiciness, moderate musty notes and hints of yogurt. Medium body. Still. Tannic mouthfeel. Red grapes and vinous finish. Drying. I prefer the regular St. Lamvinus but itÂ’s a fun and enjoyable experiment no doubt about it. Nice mix of grapey and spicy oak & fruits notes.

Bottle with Simon and Jim at Cantillon, pours a reddish purple with small head. Nose is grapes, cream, oak, light vinegar, and currants. Flavor is better with so much Wine coming through, and none of the sweetness of the nose. Flavors of oaky tannins, dark fruit, grape skins, vino and dry fruit. Medium bodied with average carbonation. Tasty

750 ml bottle at the source. The beer is a clear purple/red with a pink head of foam. The aroma had a strong, dry red wine grape character and a big fruity sourness. Taste has a complex tartness that works well with the fruit and woody notes. Medium body and medium carbonation. Great beer!

From sample thanks to Klimaet. Pours a dark bordeaux, slight hazy. Aroma has ASTRONAUTIS!!! A danish grape/raspberry popsicle. grapes, oak, loooots of vinous tannins, light funk, lots of grapes. Taste is sour, acidic, tannic, again super vinous, light cheese. Oily body. Very different!

Bottle @ Cantillon. Pours light hazy dark red with small white edges. Aromas is very tannic, vinegar, oaky, red apples, vinous. Taste is super tannic, lots of vinous fruity notes, citrus, some hay and stable notes. Like a very bretty natural wine. Super nice!

Bottle shared at the brewery. Pours a deep dark red with a slight haze, off-white head. Big red wine character, red grapes, black currant, blueberries, medium funk, quite some oak tannins, light yoghurt. Light sour, under medium sweet, dry aftertaste.

Bottle, 750 ml at the brewery. Shared with kraddel. Pours dark red with small off-white pinkish head. Very fruity, lots of grapes, quite vinous profile, wood, sour, sofr carbonation. Medium bodied. Easy to drink. Wonder how this will age.

Bottle shared at Cantillon. Slightly hazy, dark red amber. Thin ring of offehite bubbles. Dry wood, red grapes, red wine, tannins, blueberries, black currant. Light sweet, light sour and light salty. Medium body, very soft carbonation.

Bottle at the brewery. Clear deep Bordeaux color with small light pink head. Huge red wine and grapes, funk, hay, some yoghurt, raspberries, light minerals and chalk. Under medium sour, light sweet and bitter. Over medium bodied with soft fizzy carbonation. Very nice, though the grapes are a little extreme.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2017  March 17, 2017. Bottle at Cantillon. 
Clear deep purple with no head. Aroma is very fruity and vinous with juicy grapes and grape skins, very light funk, some yoghurt notes and a light touch of oak.

Taste is soft tart, fruity and vinous, light funky.
Medium bodied, slightly oily texture. Vinous finish with yoghurt, smooth sour, light grape skin astringency. 

Nice, vinous and fruity, a bit too heavy on the yoghurt though.

#50 Cantillon. 750 ml. bottle @ brewery. How is that for a sample size! This one is another wine hybrid brew by Cantillon who see themselves as wine makers and not brewers. They release products so funky & wild that even the most far out natural producer wouldnÂ’t dare to sell. I love the funk, the wildness, well the lambiek basically. Pours very deep red ruby with baiscally no head. Nose is extreme massive yoghurt profile with sour cherries & red grapes blended in. Profile is sour yoghurt, thick with fruit to the max, yoghurt lactic, no funk here actually, fermenting red grape, more sour yoghurt, red grapes, big fruit & more yoghurt. Body is all yoghurt as well. Interesting but feels like it will improve over time and gain complexity. I prefer the basic Saint Lamvinus vastly with age, about 2 years does the trick for me. Very good & interesting stuff but feels a touch too young for me.
Bottle at the source. Deep purple color, flat. Vinous aroma, mainly grapes and young red wine. Taste is tart, fruity, very dry finish. Tasty.
750ml bottle at the brewery. Pours out a deep red purple no head. Nose is great big ripe grapes and a nice vanilla barrel. Taste is more of the nice heavy grapes tart funky very nice.

Pours rather clear, dark red ro purple no real head. Smell is rich grapes, intenser than ever. Taste is very, very full grapes, mild sourness. No gas just yet, perhaps it wont come ? Or is it just too young ?
Flaske pÃ¥ cantillon, flagskibet. Nydelig stÃ¸rrelse dog findes den lidt tynd og uden samme kompleksitet som den normale variant. Stadig fed oplevelse!

Bottle at the source. Almost flat (no added sugar) with a wonderful deep red color. with beautiful subtle notes of the merlot grapes giving it a deep flavor of red berries and dark grapes. Some vanilla, tannins and balanced funk. A beautiful lambic indeed!
